values.alignmentText: Lyon’s Part-Dieu business district houses banks, biotech firms, and consultancies with mature .NET stacks, and SNCF’s digital factory mixes remote flexibility with periodic office collaboration.
The Rhône valley traps particulates in winter inversions, and NO₂ from the périphérique pushes PM2.5 toward 14 µg/m³, so the family will monitor pollution peaks before outdoor play.
Lyon’s LudiKrewe cafés, OctoGônes convention, and thriving role-play clubs give Trey deep tabletop networks without a long train ride.
Expect €3,200–€3,600 monthly for a central T4 (~€1,700 rent), transit, and childcare; salaries cover it, but budgeting for restaurant splurges matters.
Global firms like Sanofi, Capgemini, and Ubisoft Ivory Tower frequently process Talent Passport hires, though smaller Lyon startups still prefer French fluency and EU work rights.
September stays near 22 °C (72 °F) before sliding to 11 °C (52 °F) with foggy mornings along the Saône, so light jackets cover the shoulder season.
Family-sized flats in Croix-Rousse or Villeurbanne run €1,600–€1,900 and still demand guarantors; supply is better than Paris but competition spikes each September.
Corporate teams work bilingually, yet daily errands in markets or prefectures require French; English support clusters in international schools and the expat-heavy Confluence district.
La Cuisine du Web, LyonJS, and queer community centers like Centre LGBTI+ host frequent events, letting the family find progressive peers quickly.
The SMIC sits near €1,766 gross per month in 2024, supporting local hires better than many EU peers but still tight for big-city rent if we rely solely on one salary.
Venues such as Le Transbordeur, Ninkasi, and Opera de Lyon span indie gigs to classical nights, making date-night tickets easy to snag.
Riverside péniches stay lively past midnight and metro lines run late on weekends, though quieter hilltop neighborhoods wind down earlier.
Game Only and Lyon Game Dev meetups partner with schools like Bellecour École, keeping pipelines active for Trey’s studio ambitions.
Ubisoft Ivory Tower, Arkane Lyon, and Bandai Namco’s studio anchor AAA hiring, while indies such as Agharta Studio keep the ecosystem collaborative.
Weekdays move fast in Part-Dieu’s corporate core, but Presqu’île markets and Rhône riverbanks slow down evenings, giving the family a balance between hustle and leisure.
Four metro lines, two funiculars, and dense tram/BRT corridors make car-free living viable; occasional strike days require backup plans but coverage is strong.
Doctolib, Viveris, and fintech scale-ups hire Rails engineers, and remote-first teams tap Lyon for talent, though competition is stiffer than in Nantes.
Central arrondissements feel safe, but purse snatching near Part-Dieu and scooter theft in Guillotière warrant vigilance—still within comfort for a savvy family.
International School of Lyon, Ombrosa, and bilingual public streams in Lyon 2e give the boys continuity, while public lycées rank highly nationally.
Continental swings bring humid summers topping 32 °C (90 °F) and occasional winter sleet; recent canicules make air conditioning a priority.
March starts near 7 °C (45 °F) and climbs to 19 °C (66 °F) by May, though pollen from surrounding plains can bother sensitive kids.
Average highs hit 28–30 °C (82–86 °F) with recurrent heatwaves pushing beyond 35 °C (95 °F) and warm nights in the urban core, so cooling strategies are essential.
Senior engineers command €60k–€70k plus bonuses; while taxes bite, the pay aligns with Lyon’s higher housing costs.

values.key: View of Them by Neighboring Countries

values.alignmentText: Longstanding expat networks around the American Club of Lyon and bilingual schools ease integration, but prefecture queues still demand patience and French paperwork.
UNESCO-listed traboules, world-class gastronomy, and quick escapes to the Alps keep weekends full for curious parents and kids.
Every season brings common extremes, so we rely on specialized clothing, cooling, or heating solutions to stay comfortable.
Extended daylight deficits and short, cloudy summers introduce ongoing mood strain the family must actively counter.
Comfortable windows exist but are short; we stack activities in one or two prime seasons.
Lower-income families can make it work but face long waitlists or limited options in desirable neighborhoods.
Comfortable living is possible but major purchases or travel demand careful planning and occasional sacrifices.
High-end living is feasible yet demands planning around limited providers or exclusive networks.

values.key: Spacious Housing Benchmark (2k sq ft Rent)
values.alignmentText: Large rentals appear occasionally and move fast, demanding premium rent or broker connections.
Intentional communities exist but are limited in size or geared toward niche demographics.
Friendliness varies by neighborhood; we can cultivate ties but must invest time and select communities carefully.
Many acquaintances stay casual, but dedicated outreach unlocks close friendships over time.
Sidewalks cover key areas but drivers often rush, so we stay alert with children.
Processed foods are common but balanced by strong fresh markets.
Strong selection overall though certain cuisines require a bit of travel.
Higher-than-average depression rates prompt us to plan carefully for therapy access.
Moderate obesity levels exist but community efforts keep trends stable.
